intro: Tephrosia wyliei, commonly known as Wylie's tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in pods, a common feature among members of the legume family. Tephrosia wyliei is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in partial to full sunlight.
